briefdescription.para: Mutex for creation of internal SSL pointers by openssl.
Mutex for output buffer.
Start offset into internal ring buffer for client to server IO.
Start offset into internal ring buffer for server to client IO.
Internal ring buffer for client to server IO.
Internal ring buffer for server to client IO.
True if this connection is a server inbound connection from accept()
Input buffer received from socket.
Output buffer for sending to socket.
Raw file descriptor of connection.
Openssl opaque contexts.
SSL cipher in use.
For timers.
Start time of connection.
How many times we retried connect()
Hostname connected to.
Port connected to.
Bytes out.
Bytes in.
True for a plain text connection.
True if connection is completed.
True if tcp connect() succeeded.
Timer handle for one second timer.

Unique ID of socket used as a nonce You can use this to identify requests vs reply if you want. D++ itself only sets this, and does not use it in any logic. It starts at 1 and increments for each request made.
Set this to true to log all IO to debug for this connection. This is an internal developer facility. Do not enable it unless you need to, as it will be very noisy.
True if we are keeping the connection alive after it has finished.
Owning cluster.
Private key PEM file path for inbound SSL connections.
Public key PEM file path for inbound SSL connections.
Clean up resources.
Called every second.
Start SSL connection and connect to TCP endpoint.
If raw_trace is set to true, log a debug message for this connection.

For low-level debugging, calling this function will enable low level I/O logging for this connection to the logger. This can be very loud, and output a lot of data, so only enable it selectively where you need it.

detaileddescription.para: Generally, you won't need this, it is a library development utility.

briefdescription.para: Get the bytes out objectGet total bytes sent.
Get total bytes received.
Every request made has a unique ID. This increments for every request, starting at 1. You can use this for statistics, or to associate requests and replies in external event loops.
Get SSL cipher name.

memberdef.argsstring: (cluster *creator, const std::string &_hostname, const std::string &_port="443", bool plaintext_downgrade=false, bool reuse=false)
memberdef.name: ssl_connection

briefdescription.para: Connect to a specified host and port. Throws std::runtime_error on fatal error.

parameterdescription.para: the Port number to connect to
Set to true to connect using plaintext only, without initialising SSL.

Attempt to reuse previous connections for this hostname and port, if available Note that no Discord endpoints will function when downgraded. This option is provided only for connection to non-Discord addresses such as within dpp::cluster::request().

memberdef.argsstring: (cluster *creator, socket fd, uint16_t port, bool plaintext_downgrade=false, const std::string &private_key="", const std::string &public_key="")
memberdef.name: ssl_connection

briefdescription.para: Accept a new connection from listen()/accept() socket.

parameterdescription.para: Socket file descriptor assigned by accept()
Port the new fd came from
Set to true to connect using plaintext only, without initialising SSL.
if plaintext_downgrade is set to false, a private key PEM file for SSL connections
if plaintext_downgrade is set to false, a public key PEM file for SSL connections

briefdescription.para: Set up non blocking I/O and configure on_read, on_write and on_error.

parameterdescription.para: Any std::exception (or derivative) thrown from read_loop() indicates setup failed

briefdescription.para: Destroy the ssl_connection object.
Handle input from the input buffer. This function will be called until all data in the buffer has been processed and the buffer is empty.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer content. Will be modified removing any processed front elements

simplesect.para: bool True if the socket should remain connected

briefdescription.para: Write to the output buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Data to be written to the buffer.

simplesect.para: The data may not be written immediately and may be written at a later time to the socket.

briefdescription.para: Close socket connection.
Log a message.
Called while SSL handshake is in progress. If the handshake completes, the state of the socket is progressed to an established state.
Called when the TCP socket has data to read.
Called when the TCP socket can be written to without blocking.

memberdef.argsstring: (dpp::socket fd, const struct dpp::socket_events &, int error_code)
memberdef.name: on_error

briefdescription.para: Called when there is an error on the TCP socket.
Implements a simple non-blocking SSL stream connection.
